children.subject: <md>+1 i think the strength of your application comes down to the quality of the LOR and the statement of purpose</md>

@Anon Mouse and @Anon Beaker, I have asked the researcher with whom I am doing my current research in astronomy to write a letter of rec. I have also asked my former CS 61A TA (from 2 semesters ago and he is now in Stanford CS doing his PhD) to for a letter as well. 

The latter letter is to get someone reputable from EECS.
Do you have any letter of recommendation (one of which must be from a faculty member)?

history.content:
Dear EECS 101 folks,

I, Ryota Inagaki, am a second year Engineering Math and EECS major who is applying to SUPERB (Summer Undergraduate Program in Engineering Research at Berkeley). As of now, I have one research experience that I am working on (programming for an astronomer at UC Berkeley). This semester, I am set to complete CS 70, EECS 16B, Stat 134, and Math 104. As of now, no EECS upper divs yet.

I am aiming for research in AI/ML.

Do you think that I have a chance of getting in?

Thank You,

Ryota Inagaki
history.subject: SUPERB chances?
